channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: ModWaveMLP: MLP-Based Mode Decomposition and Wavelet Denoising Model to Defeat Complex Structures in Traffic Forecasting
item.description: Additionally, when handling traffic data, researchers tend to manually design the model structure based on the data features, which makes the structure of traffic prediction redundant and the model generalizability limited.

item.title: Rescaling Large Datasets Based on Validation Outcomes of a Pre-trained Network
item.description: Gathering the lowest-accuracy classes along with the most confused ones can produce a smaller subset with a higher challenge for quick validation of an early network draft.

item.title: YuLan: An Open-source Large Language Model
item.description: This paper presents the development of YuLan, a series of open-source LLMs with $12$ billion parameters.

item.title: ACES: Automatic Cohort Extraction System for Event-Stream Datasets
item.description: Reproducibility remains a significant challenge in machine learning (ML) for healthcare.

item.title: Odd-One-Out: Anomaly Detection by Comparing with Neighbors
item.description: This paper introduces a novel anomaly detection (AD) problem that focuses on identifying `odd-looking' objects relative to the other instances within a scene.

item.title: Extract More from Less: Efficient Fine-Grained Visual Recognition in Low-Data Regimes
item.description: The emerging task of fine-grained image classification in low-data regimes assumes the presence of low inter-class variance and large intra-class variation along with a highly limited amount of training samples per class.

item.title: Segment Anything without Supervision
item.description: By integrating our unsupervised pseudo masks into SA-1B's ground-truth masks and training UnSAM with only 1% of SA-1B, a lightly semi-supervised UnSAM can often segment entities overlooked by supervised SAM, exceeding SAM's AR by over 6. 7% and AP by 3. 9% on SA-1B.

item.title: LightStereo: Channel Boost Is All Your Need for Efficient 2D Cost Aggregation
item.description: We present LightStereo, a cutting-edge stereo-matching network crafted to accelerate the matching process.

item.title: GM-DF: Generalized Multi-Scenario Deepfake Detection
item.description: In this paper, we elaborately investigate the generalization capacity of deepfake detection models when jointly trained on multiple face forgery detection datasets.

item.title: ToolBeHonest: A Multi-level Hallucination Diagnostic Benchmark for Tool-Augmented Large Language Models
item.description: To address this challenge, we introduce a comprehensive diagnostic benchmark, ToolBH.

item.title: A Differentiable Approach to Multi-scale Brain Modeling
item.description: We leverage this capability of BrainPy across different brain scales.

item.title: SPIRONet: Spatial-Frequency Learning and Topological Channel Interaction Network for Vessel Segmentation
item.description: Automatic vessel segmentation is paramount for developing next-generation interventional navigation systems.

item.title: Efficient Event Stream Super-Resolution with Recursive Multi-Branch Fusion
item.description: FFM is designed for the fusion of contextual information within neighboring event streams, leveraging the coupling relationship between positive and negative events to alleviate the misleading of noises in the respective branches.

item.title: Uncovering the hidden core-periphery structure in hyperbolic networks
item.description: The hyperbolic network models exhibit very fundamental and essential features, like small-worldness, scale-freeness, high-clustering coefficient, and community structure.

item.title: CANDY: A Benchmark for Continuous Approximate Nearest Neighbor Search with Dynamic Data Ingestion
item.description: Although numerous AKNN algorithms and benchmarks have been developed recently to evaluate their effectiveness, the dynamic nature of real-world data presents significant challenges that existing benchmarks fail to address.

item.title: LLaVolta: Efficient Multi-modal Models via Stage-wise Visual Context Compression
item.description: While significant advancements have been made in compressed representations for text embeddings in large language models (LLMs), the compression of visual tokens in large multi-modal models (LMMs) has remained a largely overlooked area.

item.title: Detecting Subtle Differences between Human and Model Languages Using Spectrum of Relative Likelihood
item.description: Human and model-generated texts can be distinguished by examining the magnitude of likelihood in language.

item.title: Comprehensive Generative Replay for Task-Incremental Segmentation with Concurrent Appearance and Semantic Forgetting
item.description: Generalist segmentation models are increasingly favored for diverse tasks involving various objects from different image sources.

item.title: Molecular Facts: Desiderata for Decontextualization in LLM Fact Verification
item.description: Automatic factuality verification of large language model (LLM) generations is becoming more and more widely used to combat hallucinations.

item.title: Electrostatics-based particle sampling and approximate inference
item.description: A new particle-based sampling and approximate inference method, based on electrostatics and Newton mechanics principles, is introduced with theoretical ground, algorithm design and experimental validation.

item.title: Solving Token Gradient Conflict in Mixture-of-Experts for Large Vision-Language Model
item.description: This can lead to severe optimization conflicts between different tokens within an expert.

item.title: Precision matters: Precision-aware ensemble for weakly supervised semantic segmentation
item.description: We further extend our ensemble method to CAMs from AMN (ResNet-like) and MCTformer (ViT-like) models, achieving performance benefits in advanced WSSS models.

item.title: PM-VIS+: High-Performance Video Instance Segmentation without Video Annotation
item.description: This method achieves high video instance segmentation performance without manual video annotations, offering a cost-effective solution and new perspectives for video instance segmentation applications.

item.title: Impact of Initialization on Intra-subject Pediatric Brain MR Image Registration: A Comparative Analysis between SyN ANTs and Deep Learning-Based Approaches
item.description: Learning-based approaches, with or without linear initializations, exhibit slight superiority over SyN ANTs in terms of Dice scores.

item.title: Web2Code: A Large-scale Webpage-to-Code Dataset and Evaluation Framework for Multimodal LLMs
item.description: To address this problem, we propose Web2Code, a benchmark consisting of a new large-scale webpage-to-code dataset for instruction tuning and an evaluation framework for the webpage understanding and HTML code translation abilities of MLLMs.

item.title: Meta Learning for Efficient Fine-Tuning of Large Language Models
item.description: The research investigates the application of meta-learning strategies to enhance the adaptability and performance of LLMs with limited computational resources.

item.title: PopAlign: Population-Level Alignment for Fair Text-to-Image Generation
item.description: To address this limitation, we introduce PopAlign, a novel approach for population-level preference optimization, while standard optimization would prefer entire sets of samples over others.

item.title: MuGSI: Distilling GNNs with Multi-Granularity Structural Information for Graph Classification
item.description: To tackle the second challenge, MuGSI proposes to incorporate a node feature augmentation component, thereby enhancing the expressiveness of the student MLPs and making them more capable learners.

item.title: LLaRA: Supercharging Robot Learning Data for Vision-Language Policy
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) equipped with extensive world knowledge and strong reasoning skills can tackle diverse tasks across domains, often by posing them as conversation-style instruction-response pairs.

item.title: ROS-LLM: A ROS framework for embodied AI with task feedback and structured reasoning
item.description: Key features of the framework include: integration of ROS with an AI agent connected to a plethora of open-source and commercial LLMs, automatic extraction of a behavior from the LLM output and execution of ROS actions/services, support for three behavior modes (sequence, behavior tree, state machine), imitation learning for adding new robot actions to the library of possible actions, and LLM reflection via human and environment feedback.

item.title: MM-Instruct: Generated Visual Instructions for Large Multimodal Model Alignment
item.description: This paper introduces MM-Instruct, a large-scale dataset of diverse and high-quality visual instruction data designed to enhance the instruction-following capabilities of large multimodal models (LMMs).

item.title: CSAKD: Knowledge Distillation with Cross Self-Attention for Hyperspectral and Multispectral Image Fusion
item.description: This paper introduces a novel knowledge distillation (KD) framework for HR-MSI/LR-HSI fusion to achieve SR of LR-HSI.

item.title: Pairwise Difference Learning for Classification
item.description: Pairwise difference learning (PDL) has recently been introduced as a new meta-learning technique for regression.

item.title: GRACE: Graph-Regularized Attentive Convolutional Entanglement with Laplacian Smoothing for Robust DeepFake Video Detection
item.description: As DeepFake video manipulation techniques escalate, posing profound threats, the urgent need to develop efficient detection strategies is underscored.

item.title: SeaKR: Self-aware Knowledge Retrieval for Adaptive Retrieval Augmented Generation
item.description: This paper introduces Self-aware Knowledge Retrieval (SeaKR), a novel adaptive RAG model that extracts self-aware uncertainty of LLMs from their internal states.

item.title: CELLO: Causal Evaluation of Large Vision-Language Models
item.description: Previous work typically focuses on commonsense causality between events and/or actions, which is insufficient for applications like embodied agents and lacks the explicitly defined causal graphs required for formal causal reasoning.

item.title: Spiking Convolutional Neural Networks for Text Classification
item.description: Spiking neural networks (SNNs) offer a promising pathway to implement deep neural networks (DNNs) in a more energy-efficient manner since their neurons are sparsely activated and inferences are event-driven.

item.title: Towards Learning Abductive Reasoning using VSA Distributed Representations
item.description: We introduce the Abductive Rule Learner with Context-awareness (ARLC), a model that solves abstract reasoning tasks based on Learn-VRF.

item.title: DEX-TTS: Diffusion-based EXpressive Text-to-Speech with Style Modeling on Time Variability
item.description: Expressive Text-to-Speech (TTS) using reference speech has been studied extensively to synthesize natural speech, but there are limitations to obtaining well-represented styles and improving model generalization ability.

item.title: Suri: Multi-constraint Instruction Following for Long-form Text Generation
item.description: Existing research on instruction following largely focuses on tasks with simple instructions and short responses.

item.title: Learning Pareto Set for Multi-Objective Continuous Robot Control
item.description: For a control problem with multiple conflicting objectives, there exists a set of Pareto-optimal policies called the Pareto set instead of a single optimal policy.

item.title: STBench: Assessing the Ability of Large Language Models in Spatio-Temporal Analysis
item.description: The rapid evolution of large language models (LLMs) holds promise for reforming the methodology of spatio-temporal data mining.

item.title: HUWSOD: Holistic Self-training for Unified Weakly Supervised Object Detection
item.description: Most WSOD methods rely on traditional object proposals to generate candidate regions and are confronted with unstable training, which easily gets stuck in a poor local optimum.

item.title: Read Anywhere Pointed: Layout-aware GUI Screen Reading with Tree-of-Lens Grounding
item.description: In this paper, we propose a Tree-of-Lens (ToL) agent, utilizing a novel ToL grounding mechanism, to address the SPR task.

item.title: From Biased Selective Labels to Pseudo-Labels: An Expectation-Maximization Framework for Learning from Biased Decisions
item.description: Inspired by causal models of selective labels, we propose Disparate Censorship Expectation-Maximization (DCEM), an algorithm for learning in the presence of disparate censorship.

item.title: Dysca: A Dynamic and Scalable Benchmark for Evaluating Perception Ability of LVLMs
item.description: Besides, these benchmarks merely focus on evaluating LVLMs on the realistic style images and clean scenarios, leaving the multi-stylized images and noisy scenarios unexplored.

item.title: SSP: Self-Supervised Prompting for Cross-Lingual Transfer to Low-Resource Languages using Large Language Models
item.description: We investigate their effectiveness for NLP tasks in low-resource languages (LRLs), especially in the setting of zero-labelled cross-lingual transfer (0-CLT), where no labelled training data for the target language is available -- however training data from one or more related medium-resource languages (MRLs) is utilized, alongside the available unlabeled test data for a target language.

item.title: Factor multivariate stochastic volatility models of high dimension
item.description: We propose a two-stage estimation procedure for the fMSV model: the first stage obtains the estimators of the factor model, and the second stage estimates the MSV part using the estimated common factor variables.

item.title: Temporally Multi-Scale Sparse Self-Attention for Physical Activity Data Imputation
item.description: Wearable sensors enable health researchers to continuously collect data pertaining to the physiological state of individuals in real-world settings.

item.title: SimpleFusion: A Simple Fusion Framework for Infrared and Visible Images
item.description: Integrating visible and infrared images into one high-quality image, also known as visible and infrared image fusion, is a challenging yet critical task for many downstream vision tasks.
